blog-minecraft-server-title: Private Minecraft Server: VPN, Backup & Performance Optimization
blog-minecraft-server-meta-description: A hands-on blog about setting up and optimizing a private Minecraft server with Docker, OpenVPN, RAID backups, and resource-efficient server configuration.
blog-minecraft-server-heading: Private Minecraft Server: VPN, Backup & Performance Optimization
blog-minecraft-server-section-1-title: Why Run a Private Minecraft Server?
blog-minecraft-server-section-1-text: I run my own Minecraft server to have full control over the game environment, security, and performance. With a self-hosted setup, I can create custom certificates for VPN connections and optimize the server efficiently.
blog-minecraft-server-section-2-text: The server runs on Linux, secured with RAID-1 and regular backups. This ensures that data and worlds are always protected. The architecture is designed to save resources and run the server.jar efficiently.
blog-minecraft-server-section-3-text: The server runs inside a Docker container, simplifying maintenance and isolating the environment. Updates and configurations can be handled efficiently through this setup.
blog-minecraft-server-section-4-text: Players connect through an OpenVPN network, so no direct port forwarding to the internet is required. All connections are encrypted and secured with custom certificates.
